Query:
select a.AuthorId, a.Name as [AuthorName], a.ZipCodeId, c.Name as City from Author a
inner join Zipcode zc on zc.ZipCodeId = a.ZipCodeId
inner join City c on c.CityId = zc.CityId
where c.Name = 'Charlotte'

select * from Author where Author.ZipCodeId in (select zc.ZipCodeId from ZipCode zc where zc.CityId in (select c.CityId from City c where c.StateId in (select StateId from State where ShortName in ('NY', 'NC'))))
select zc.ZipCode, a.Name from ZipCode zc inner join Author a on a.ZipCodeId = zc.ZipCodeId where zc.ZipCodeId = 12

Comment: aarbac recommends to use table or alias prefix, this query will parse good, but will throw error while executing ```Ambiguous column name 'ZipCodeId'```
Query: select * from Author where ZipCodeId in (select zc.ZipCodeId from ZipCode zc where zc.CityId in (select c.CityId from City c where c.StateId in (select StateId from State where ShortName in ('NY', 'NC'))))

Comment: Simple insert with specific column names
Simple update, Lashawn has permission to update Name
Query: update Author set Name='abc' where AuthorId = 1

Comment: Simple update, Lashawn does not have permission to update SSN
Query: update Author set SSN='abc' where AuthorId = 1

UPDATE a 
SET a.Name = 'abc' 
FROM dbo.Author AS a
INNER JOIN dbo.ZipCode AS zc 
       ON a.ZipCodeId = a.ZipCodeId
WHERE zc.ZipCode = '00000'
